website_summaries.verdict: For those looking to jump up from entry-level drills, this powerful 8.0 A drill is in one word, “monstrous” in terms of the jobs it can handle. Corded power means reliable, steady drill speed and power.
pros: This heavy-duty, variable speed corded drill features an 8 A motor
A ratcheting keyless chuck that clicks once locked allows for quick bit swaps
A long power cord and built-in level round out the features
cons: The variable speed setting is way too variable, jumping between too slow and way too fast

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill
customer_reviews.text: I've always preferred DeWalt tools but the price has at times been prohibitive. I needed a new drill to replace a Craftsman drill that had finally died after many years of unfailing service. I found this drill at an excellent price so I bought it. Thus far it's driven drywall screws through the drywall into kiln dried lumber, drilled holes into hardwood without hesitation, drilled holes using a hole saw attachment etc. Note of caution: although this is a variable speed drill it doesn't like low rpm's. With some patience you can feather the trigger to achieve a low rpm but really the drill is a beast!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: The All-Around Drill
customer_reviews.text: This is the drill for you. This is a well-built, brand name drill that will serve you well in building a workbench, assembling bunk beds for your kids, framing a barn - the usual stuff. It is well balanced for all sorts of work, unlike it's fraternal twin the DWD112 which has all the weight on the front end and is incredibly unwieldy in situations other than vertical drilling. If you're a handy person looking to buy a drill that will last and will get the jobs done well, this is it. It has surpassed my trusty Vise-Grips as my favorite tool.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice

customer_reviews.title: No Wobble
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews, I had real concerns about this drill having significant wobble or runout. Immediately after receiving it, I put a 36-inch long, 3/8" straight shank installer bit into the chuck and ran the drill at the lowest speed and the highest speed. There was minimal detectable bit wobble in the vertical orientation. Naturally, the sag in the long shank caused significant wobble in the horizontal position, but that's not the fault of the drill. Also, I had no problem achieving low enough speed for driving screws. This looks to be a good product if used with a modicum of common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 Year Review
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked well for three years. Used about a dozen times a year. Put away nicely after each use. I noticed the chuck was getting harder to release recently and today it seized completely. Let down by yet another disposable power tool.
customer_reviews.author: David Squire

customer_reviews.title: Excellent entry-level drill
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and great! This is a very balanced drill with a bunch of power. It's got very little recoil and and lot of strength behind bit driving. The only thing I would change would be to improve speed control. It's possible to slow the rotation of the chuck with some effort, but the control is a bit crude. This is a minor complaint when it comes down to it. I really like this drill!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Hoelscher

customer_reviews.title: Nice drill. Chuck is junk
customer_reviews.text: If you're doing much metal drilling, Do Not buy this driil. You're drills will slip in the chuck. This is a decent drill in most ways. However, when the going gets tough drills slip in chuck, wastes time and ruins expensive drills. My mistake, I knew I shouldn't have purchased a drill without a keyed or clutch locking chuck... Purchased drill to get away from this problem: right back to square one..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If You Need a Corded Drill, This May Be It ...
customer_reviews.text: Having worn out his old Craftsman corded drill, my woodworking husband needed a replacement. Although he uses a cordless drill most of the time, he needs one that is capable of long periods of use without recharging. The "DEWALT Corded Drill, 8.0-Amp, 3/8-Inch, Variable Speed Reversible, Mid-Handle Grip" was perfect for his needs and Amazon's price was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: delicateflower152

customer_reviews.title: Overkill in the Amp Dept. Me Likes!
customer_reviews.text: Great power and balance. But, it's a drill, not a screwdriver device. There is no clutch adjustment and at 8 amps, you'll strip your screws. I purchased a Brush-less motor, Drill/Impact set for portability but when it comes to sure power, this one will do it every time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Well Balanced Driver
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because I was tired of the batteries on cordless drills that seem to only last about a year. Then after the year the batteries going discontinued to new drill designs. So decided to go with a corded one. This drill seems perfect for home use. The handle being in the center of the drill, opposed to the rear of it, keeps it well balanced. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Tony G

customer_reviews.title: i bought this drill to finish out a carport i'm ...
customer_reviews.text: i bought this drill to finish out a carport i'm building. the cordless batteries just don't last. this is a 1/2" drive drill hiding in a 3/8" drive drill. i read the other reviews about quick trigger loading and thought they were just impatient, until it jerked itself out of my hand. literally, not figuratively. this is a very powerful drill. i deducted one star for the hairline trigger and too much power in a small package. this drill drives 4-1/2" lag screws (5/16") into 8" timbers with no effort at all. and when i say no effort, i mean no loading effort at all. it doesn't even go to idle speed.
customer_reviews.author: louielouie

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Loads more powerful than other cordless drills at this price. Unless portability is an immense concern, I would give this a good look. I also have used this for woodworking, couldn’t be happier. Was able to bore 1” holes in 8/4 hard maple without issue. The level in the back of the drill also helped make this straight. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dnindiod2

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and hold.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for easy to use quality drill. I am remodeling a home and have 5 different drills on site this is the favorite drill for everyone on site. The biggest problem is I only own one and everyone wants to use it instead of ant of the other deills on site.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Thankfully this has a good variable control that allows you to put just the ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy smokes is this powerful! Thankfully this has a good variable control that allows you to put just the right amount of torque on your bit, but just don't getting sloppy with it otherwise it will strip your screws in a second. This is all a good thing though. You have the power when you need it, and you never get that horrible binding feeling of an underpowered drill. Also, the balance on it is enough to make Clint Eastwood proud to draw it out. This sits nicely on your hand without any effort to keep it balance. Now get out there and shoot some holes in your foes... I mean drill some holes.
customer_reviews.author: Ice cream samarai salami

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomics!
customer_reviews.text: Great ergonomics. Don't ignore this feature! Usually only in 1/2" drills but it is nice to have in a 3/8ths as well. Never had it before but I like it now. Also - the bubble level is very handy. Works in both horizontal and vertical drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Learning2

customer_reviews.title: Better Balance
customer_reviews.text: My 40 year old electric drill (!) needed to be replaced. This one attracted me with the handle placement. I provides a lot more balance. The weight is above my hand, not out in front, trying to rotate out of hand.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Jones

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS DRILL NO MORE WEAK BATTERIES
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS A YEAR AGO BUT WAITED TO REVIEW IT. I WAS A LITTLE WORRIED ABOUT SOME OF THE BAD RATING, HOWEVER I HAVE NOT EXPERIENCE ANY OF THEM. I CAN'T SAY ENOUGH ABOUT THE POWER, ESPECIALLY SINCE I HAVE NEVER EXPERIENCE THAT WITH ANY RECHARGEABLE DRILLS(NO COMPARISION IN POWER AND SPEED) I AGREE WITH ALL THE POSITIVE THINGS: THE BALANCE AND POSITION OF THE MID HANDLE AND LOVE THE THE 2 BUBBLES BALANCES TO HELP YOU DRILL STRAIGHT. THIS IS MY GO TO DRILL WHEN I AM GOING TO DO SERIOUS DRILLING AND DECK SCREWING. YES IT HAS CORD! WHO CARES WHEN YOU GOT THIS KIND OF POWER AND SPEED. BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: (JAK) James  Kaniper

customer_reviews.title: Forgot how good a real drill was
customer_reviews.text: I have been solely using an 18v DeWalt drill for years and came across this on sale. Wow, it is nice not having to swap out battery packs when drilling lots of holes. Now I use this to drill and the 18v to screw things together. A great combination that allows me to work faster. The two bubble levels on this drill were a pleasant surprise. Very useful when you want to drill a level or perpendicular hole. And the chuck, what a great design. Talk about easy and fast. A real improvement as it takes only a quarter turn to lock or unlock. A great tool to have in your bag.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hefty 3/8 Inch Drill
customer_reviews.text: The drill has a hefty feel. I wanted a dedicated drill for the workbench. Why not get a cordless since there is always power at the bench and keep the cordless drills for off site. It is exactly what I needed/wanted. It is hefty, the chuck is convenient and a nice size for quick changing. I chose the 115 for the balance and am glad I did. The 113 (a different pistol design) might have an advantage in some situations but the balance of the 115 outweighed the potential advantage in tight spots.
customer_reviews.author: Vridar

customer_reviews.title: has some torque to it
customer_reviews.text: Great product with a lot of torque. Was hesitant on buying a dewalt being that they make their stuff in china now. Overall its good for the money defiantly feels better in the hand to use. The mid grip is very nice for one handed use vs pistol grip. Id buy it again
customer_reviews.author: sweatyyetti

customer_reviews.title: drill has worse chuck I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: The "new and approved" fails to allow tightening on a drill bit allowing it to simply spin but the drill bit stays stationary. Will not purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Love the drill, glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome... So do you think I like it. used it a ton. love it. I bought a second one for my son. lots of power, love the design. if you need a drill buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Hem

customer_reviews.title: Superb Drill - Best in Class for less than $100.
customer_reviews.text: The balance of this drill makes it a joy to use. It was a blessing to have when I was doing a recent tile project. The variable speed settings allowed me to mix the adhesive and grout without creating clouds of dust or any spattering whatsoever. I really pushed it hard mixing both products and it performed like a drill I would expect to cost a lot more. The case is nicely designed and narrow. It allows me to carry all my bits, even the ones for going through deep walls. The chuck is a first rate piece of tool engineering. Best drill I have seen for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth Be Told......

customer_reviews.title: All good except for one annoying thing.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill. Probably the best overall I had in terms of power and durability. The only thing I don’t like is the position of the switch for changing direction and the switch itself. It is very awkward to have to reach in front of the handle/button with your finger instead of having it at the side next to your thumb like other drills. Hope they get it sorted soon.
customer_reviews.author: A. Prongidis

customer_reviews.title: A very good corded drill.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill because of the fact that it was corded. I have 2 drills that are battery and have had many a headache when I needed a drill only to find that the battery has died. This is a tough drill and does everything I can throw at it. Very glad I bought it because it is my go to drill when tork is needed. Most battery drills fail at giving good tork. It hasn't let me down yet and I like the brand DeWalt very much.
customer_reviews.author: Crabhappy

customer_reviews.title: Love dewalt everything so far.
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for various basic jobs/ tasks around my house and my mom's house over the last year or so. Shelves, curtains, tv wall mounts, etc. Hasn't disappointed yet. I don't see why I would need anything more expensive. Feels very well made just like my other dewalt tools. I don't want to deal with batteries for cordless models and have not yet minded the extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: miggys3

customer_reviews.title: DON'T EXPECT IT TO LAST
customer_reviews.text: I baby my tools (and everything else). Just beyond the warranty period the variable speed trigger switch went. For a brief time the tool wouldn't operate at all until the trigger was pulled most of the way, when it would jump to a high speed. Then there was nothing. It's a dead drill.
customer_reviews.author: Fuddled

customer_reviews.title: Great for polishing car headlights
customer_reviews.text: I have an 20 year old DeWalt cordless drill that I was trying to use to buff and polish my headlights. The batteries kept dying and I needed it to run for more than 15 minutes at a time. I got the corded drill just for that and it worked like a charm. My headlights are clear as day. I like that it's lightweight and easy to hold and the keyless chuck made changing out the attachments quick and easy. I've also used it to drill pilot holes and put up some shelves. Great tool and never disappointed with DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: FreddyMo

customer_reviews.title: when you need power nothing beats a wired device
customer_reviews.text: love the amps and the ease with which I could change the bit and how it holds so well. light and strong.
customer_reviews.author: David Ducolon

customer_reviews.title: Trigger Is Too Sensitive
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I'm sure it is up to most tasks, even on a pro level. I've drilled holes in concrete and metal with ease. One major downside is that the trigger is so sensitive that you can literally destroy your job or strip your hardware in a split second. Choking down on the trigger helps, but if you are just looking for a drill for odd jobs and quick screws around the house, you might want to look for something with more reasonable trigger.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy light/medium duty drill
customer_reviews.text: Good, sturdy light/medium duty drill. I'm not a professional mechanic or carpenter so I don't give it the use a pro might but it works for me; quality is good and price reasonable. I do like the mid-pistol grip so you can get your other hand on the back of it when you need some extra push. I also have their 10-amp, 1/2" drive drill for heavy duty work. They make a good combo. I only shorted it one star because it doesn't have bubble levels built in.
customer_reviews.author: R. White

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a man
customer_reviews.text: I got this last Christmas for my husband and he loves it. I even able to use it with out any problem.
customer_reviews.author: texasgirl53

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a corded tool for repetitive heavy drilling. This works great. Have cordless also so can team the tools to the job.
customer_reviews.author: nam vet

customer_reviews.title: Got tired of relying on questionable rechargeable batteries
customer_reviews.text: With DeWalt you're getting a brand name, the product is well priced and performs great, I was looking for a drill that didn't have a battery and just an old-fashioned power cord, many can provide this few at such a good price with value
customer_reviews.author: mike000mike

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered
customer_reviews.text: Physically this is a very well made drill. It has very high rpm's but very low torque. This is compared to my ancient, battery powered Craftsman which powered through metal and wood without problems. This one the bit get stuck often and i have to reverse the drill to get the bit out. If you are doing precision work this is definitely not for you but should be ok for basic household tasks
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: disappointed from this product.
customer_reviews.text: Was using this drill to make 3/16 holes on 16 gauge steel. I did 50 holes and the drill completely stop working. Not sure if this is a defect. I beleive in dewalt products, all my tools are dewalt and I was never been disappointed until now. Not sure what to do...
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Drills through wood like butter
customer_reviews.text: True to brand name, this powered drill from Dewalt is outstanding. I look forward to doing work with it, that's how good it is.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill. I was surprised by the amount of power this thing has. If it’s your first drill (it was for me) I’d recommend practicing a few times on some scrap wood but then you should be good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Just what my husband needed. His was 12 years old and died. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: It is a great drill, as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight, easy to use, excellent power, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great power
customer_reviews.text: There are a TON of drills on the market. For a corded drill, this one works very well. I have used it for a while and it does everything I need it to. Plenty of power even when drilling through thick tile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Always buy a Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement because I gave mine to my son. Like all Dewalt products, this drill will be functional for untold years in the future and I know I will never have to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Msgr. Jack Sweeley

customer_reviews.title: Little heavy
customer_reviews.text: The drill has all kinds of power. It happens to be heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Electric drill
customer_reviews.text: This was a birthday gift for my husband. He has been postponing certain house jobs because his old drill was not working properly-it was always a struggle to use. He was very delighted to receive this drill without shopping around for it as he hates to shop. He has not used I ye but we are both looking forward to watching it work wonders on these long outstanding projects. I think he was very pleased that it met all of his qualifications and looked so sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: ABB

customer_reviews.title: Best little drill I've owned so far
customer_reviews.text: I have some Makita and Skil drills that work fine, but I was building a deck and wanted something easier on my wrist. I bought this drill and have been extremely pleased. 1.) The keyless chuck works better than any drill I have ever used 2.) Lightweight 3.) Excellent speed control 4.) Level bubbles are very handy This is an well designed quality-built tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Good, Good, Good
customer_reviews.text: Excellent corded drill. Very high torque. We used it to drill 3" holes, 6" deep into red clay soil with an auger. Worked like a champ. Drilled over 500 3" holes to plant mondo grass.
customer_reviews.author: JNthePen

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the DWD110K
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the DWD110k at local hardware store then returned it to get the DWD115K. Although both item weigh the same the 115 has the handle in the middle of drill makes the tool feel more balanced and less weight on hand. I can use one hand to hold the screw while i use other hand for driving. The 110k is front heavy since it's designed like a shot gun. Another big plus is that 115k comes with a hard case where the 110k comes with a nylon bag.
customer_reviews.author: sMartsHoper

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy-duty drill
customer_reviews.text: I needed a corded drill for the jobs that all my cordless ones couldn't handle. So I didn't even look at the light-duty corded drills. My last corded drill was a Hitachi, which burned out within 15 minutes of when I started to use it. This one is heavy-duty and also is heavy, so you're not going to want to haul it around or hold it in your hands for hours on end. But when you need a strong drill, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Engineering Geek

customer_reviews.title: Drill worked well and am glad I finally replaced my old electric drill
customer_reviews.text: Used after my always worked work horse rechargeable drills failed while doing a multiple deadbolt lock project (steel door 3 x bore 3 door knob size holes using black n decker kit . Drill worked well and am glad I finally replaced my old electric drill . Center mount handle less fatiguing . I'd buy again great product for the money
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: POWERFULL TOOL
customer_reviews.text: Great everyday drill. It has a lot of torque and easy to use. Highly recommend it for any one who doesn't want to worry about running out of battery on a cordless drill. I sold my Craftsman 19.2 volt cordless drill cheap which I had for about 4 years. The batteries where getting weak and it didn't have the torque to drill through heavy boards or metal.
customer_reviews.author: The Great King

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed for easier handling and control
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed for easier handling and control. I replaced a much older Dewalt that had a worn out chuck, the older one was a conventional rear hand grip, this is much nicer to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I'm no professional...just a DIY guy that does small projects around the house. The unit is a little bit bulky and hard to get into smaller areas but overall, I like the speed and consistent power that you get from a corded drill. I had thought about buying a battery powered drill for convenience but because I don't use it very often, I'm afraid the batteries would die on me if left uncharged for extended periods.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L Lau

customer_reviews.title: My best buy of the year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a big project. Drives 3" screws effortlessly into deck lumber. I am back to dragging a cord but no battery hassles and a lot of torque. The keyless chuck is solid and the mid body handle is great for working in tight places. Dewalt has not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Alan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drill For The Price
customer_reviews.text: Nice corded drill. I've had mine exactly a year now. The drill bits stay on and I've had no problems at all. This drill is for general occasional use which was exactly what I was looking for. If I built homes for a living and used it every day I would probably go with something more heavy-duty.
customer_reviews.author: MiG-15

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted another drill that was powerful enough to bore holes in pipes at home. The Amp rating on this drill seemed suitable for this job at home so I bought it. I am well pleased with my purchase, it does the job and the keyless chuck is quite convenient. So I will recommend this product to any craftsman because it is worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Roger Amoroso

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is so powerful and great to have if you need a drill. I don't use it for any commercial purposes only for home repairs and such. But make sure to buy the drill bits for it from Dewalt. The beautiful sleek case it comes with has a slot when you place the Dewalt drill bit box (14-piece) into the drill case.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Y

customer_reviews.title: Surprised- great little drill
customer_reviews.text: My first drill with this kind of configuration- with the handle under the center instead of the conventional pistol grip. Took a little getting used to, but well balanced providing a straighter hole. Typical Dewalt reliability and ruggedness. Gutsy drill. I'm old school- was never a fan of keyless chuck, so a real challenge to trust this, but so far so good, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and a DWD112. My husband has stronger hands and arms than I do, and he prefers the DWD112 with the handle well behind the motor. I prefer the DWD115K because the handle is under the motor - it's easier to balance and my hand and arm doesn't get as fatigued. Other than the position of the handles, I think these are basically the same drill.
customer_reviews.author: KWms

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: Ive always used cheaper drills and every yrea or so i had to go buy a new one. This thing is built well and after using it a few times I can tell you it has plenty of power and torque. Its easy to change out bits and drivers, and I love the way it feels. I would highley recomend this drill. And if thats not enough, Its Dewalt. Second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Good company that fixed their problem
customer_reviews.text: Off axis right out of the box. Contacted Dewalt, and they sent me a new drill free of charge. Good company that fixed their problem. I'd consider the first drill they sent me to be a lemon. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Weegee

customer_reviews.title: like all my desalt products
customer_reviews.text: I have no wobble in my chuck at all. Drills true and straight, like all my desalt products. This is a great product and very cheap. I've been using it for car polishing, mixing grout, and driving screws in a new large deck. It handles all of it without a hiccup and power to spare. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: jdavis_2014

customer_reviews.title: Good balance, power and grip
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific drill. The keyless chuck clicks as you tighten it down (i love that), the level is visible at the top as it should be, the 8-amp power is perfect for everything a handy person needs. I've drilled concrete walls, thick gauge metal and wood. The mid-handle grip helps you keep the drill straight. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J Cacace

customer_reviews.title: these are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: comes with it's own convenient carrying case, and a pocket for a Dewalt drill bit set. I have two, these are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Margison

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Nicely balanced drill. Not too heavy while still feeling like Dewalt quality construction. Perfect speed and comfortable trigger. I did a lot of reaserach and this seemed to be highly rated and a great value for the price range.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyintheD

customer_reviews.title: It's wibbly wobbly
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews of this drill before buying it, and I noticed some people said the drill wobbled. But I thought, hey, this drill wouldn't have such a high rating if that really happened, right? Well, I got the drill, and it wobbles all over the place. It's not the bit---I can see the chuck wobbling, and I even put the bit into another drill to double-check (no wobble on the other drill). I did notice it doesn't wobble nearly as much if you run it at top speed. But that makes the variable speed feature kind of useless. In short, don't buy this drill.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drill
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be an outstanding product reasonable economical very easy to use and it was delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold E. Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: I tried to contact amazon when the item did not ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to contact amazon when the item did not work correctly and I have not got an answer back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Raw power
customer_reviews.text: I was reminded what power really is after using this beast. I'm a fan of cordless tools for their extreme portability. After witnessing the things this driver can do, I just grab an extension cord with this thing in my hand and grin with anticipation as I proceed to the task that will undoubtedly be conquered. Period.
customer_reviews.author: O B

customer_reviews.title: Best drill I’ve had for a while.
customer_reviews.text: Mid grip makes it very easy to handle. Has plenty of power. I’m able to feather the trigger with precision.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonie

customer_reviews.title: Power as well control
customer_reviews.text: I am really glad that got a corded drill. This is ready when you need as long as you need. Very impressed by the torque when you give full throttle as well slow turns when you mildly pull the trigger. Haven't observed any wobble so far. Four stars because sometimes small bits slip when you try to retract by reversing while the drill bit is in the wood half way. This is my first and only drill. So cant compare with others.
customer_reviews.author: Subramaniyan

customer_reviews.title: Too fast for wood auger bits
customer_reviews.text: This drill is easy to handle and is well suited for close quarter work and has a lot of power. However, the variable speed switch is too touchy; it needs to allow a greater range of variable drill speed from low speed to full speed than what it does. Other than that, it is a good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C Myers

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This baby is heavy! It’s hard to use if you’re not a body builder
customer_reviews.author: @abadassforce

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt DWD 115k
customer_reviews.text: If you have plenty of time to kill --I suppose you could research corded drills forever. Drill I received came in a nice Dewalt case-- Which is fine but its just not something I use. Drill has plenty of power and for this kind of money-- You cannot beat this deal-- Buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: POWER
customer_reviews.text: Heck of a Drill lot of Power a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Chacon

customer_reviews.title: Great drill!
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY love this powerful, well built drill. I have powered thru anything i needed around house and I personally would rather use a corded one as all the ones i have had batteries with, 1- cost too much to replace battery and 2- don't have the power i need at times.
customer_reviews.author: Love movies that make you think.

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around drill.  Handle placement is ergonomic. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: Great drill--fits my light-duty use needs, although I'm sure it will do much more. I got it because I kept killing cordless batteries due to lack of use. I have a short extension cord in the bag for plug and play. I like the handle placement--good balance for getting at those hard-to-reach screws. Also cuts down wrist strain. Yes, a little loud but again, I am an infrequent user.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drill I've been looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is the drill I've been looking for. It has plenty of power and is well balanced. Yet not too heavy. My first project was building a rain water reservoir. I used the drill for pilot holes, Screw deck screws, and saw cutouts in plastic drums. <> My next project was installing shelving on concrete block walls. The drill drove the bit in quickly compared to my older electric. This will probably be the last drill I ever buy. 2 years ago I bought a nice CH battery drill. Now it sits in it's case because the battery won't last 10 minutes. Get a corded drill with power and that's what you will have for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves to construct and I bought it for ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves to construct and I bought it for her. She loves it and it works well for me. Well balanced and not heavy to hold for long periods of time
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Check pricing if your a Vet
customer_reviews.text: I received the item as advertised. I was surprised in the weight though. I thought it would be lighter. As a military retiree, I could have bought the product at Lowes for 10% less. I do a lot of buying on the internet though, so I am satisfied with the product and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing amount of power!
customer_reviews.text: This is a Beast!! If you have any real driving that you just can not get done without your Battery powered Drill?? This Bad Boy will do it!! It is awesome! The harder you pull the trigger the faster it drills!
customer_reviews.author: EBCIII

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent except lacks a locking trigger and speed control limit
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, well built. Have used and abused it for years now.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: What a drill!
customer_reviews.text: First drill I have ever bought with a center grip, but it won't be my last. For me it is so much easier to use due to the balance feel of the drill in my hand. Very easy to used and very powerful. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't expect anything more than this. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike cordless drills so I picked up this guy. Love it, powerful but doesn't jerk your wrist, I use it for all sorts of projects, drilling, screwing, cleaning. I wouldn't expect anything more than this.
customer_reviews.author: Drew R. Frantz

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels like a quality tool and plenty of power, comes in a nice case. I can't testify on the durability as I've only used it a few times but I'm sure this is the last drill I'll ever buy!
customer_reviews.author: Russell Mott

customer_reviews.title: Love the Balanced Weight - Perfect for Women
customer_reviews.text: Great drill for a woman, because the weight is balanced to the middle of the drill. Has the power you need for a corded drill, with what feels like less weight because of the design. Brillant.
customer_reviews.author: I. Hepler

customer_reviews.title: SUPER!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this drill! It has more than enough power to handle any job. Kind of heavy, but not a problem. Actually gives you the feeling that you can handle anything that comes along.
customer_reviews.author: jeffinvegas

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill
customer_reviews.text: Excellent the body design is the difference in this drill, very easy on the arms and wrist. Would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: works better and has some punch
customer_reviews.text: I had a Black & Decker drill for at least 20 Years ,ran it till it quit . I no sooner got this beauty and put it to work . I'm sold , works better and has some punch , thanks for the reviews , made a difference . Thanks again Doug Folk
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great drill for the money. This is my second DEWALT drill. It's powerful , you'll love it. I really enjoy using this one over my battery powered DEWALT drill.
customer_reviews.author: Angel  M  Berrios

customer_reviews.title: Nice Drill, great price
customer_reviews.text: I already own a pretty cheap 7.6v portable ni-cad drill, but it was awful at drilling. I do not do a lot of drilling but needed this to mount a couple TVs in my house. It definitely did not disappoint. So much power. I will post an update once I have used it more for home repair projects. Update 6/29/2012: Still working great. Just used it to complete a workbench for the garage and it performed great. Great to pair with another battery drill that way you can switch between drilling and driving screws quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love rigid drill. Well balanced, strong, and not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: larry

customer_reviews.title: Good Drill at a great value
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a key-less drill without the added cost of battery. If you are looking to have an all round drill for your home and want to avoid the higher cost of battery, I would definitely recommend this. I have used this drill on both Brick Masonry & Metal.
customer_reviews.author: NJBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Great drill.
customer_reviews.text: This drill works great, I like the corded versions for when I need the power, and higher RPM. This drill has lasted me a long time, and its still going great. I like Dewalt brand tools, and have had no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShoppers

customer_reviews.title: Nothing beats an 8amp corded drill. How everyone has ...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing beats an 8amp corded drill. How everyone has been convinced to go cordless on everything is beyond me. This will still be working long after I'm dead.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Generally Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I use the drill for light duty jobs around the house. Seems well constructed and balanced. It is not light weight and I have noticed some bit precession which I did not expect from a Dewalt product.
customer_reviews.author: Selective Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a New York City contractor and I need good dependable tools. I ordered one and my guys would fight over it, so I ordered more. It really is better balanced! It just feels better which results in less fatigue and greater accuracy. And the keyless chuck works well which is a big change from other brands we tried. The chord is long enough, the trigger is smooth and subtle, and the reversing control is effortless. Good job DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Well balance drill
customer_reviews.text: This drill seems well balance, has power, runs well at low speeds. It has an ample power cord.There is a little wobble in the drill but one has to remember it is a hand drill not a table drill.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! It's still going after many years using it, not heavily, but a moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Cash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool - quality construction
customer_reviews.text: This drill has great torque and is reasonably quiet for its capability. Nice balanced grip and I really like the large size trigger area - easy to do fine manipulation with gloves. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: GJGAJ4936

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as others have posted
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the motor, trigger are excellent. The balance and mid body handle position is genius. The only knock is the chuck doesn't lock down tightly enough.
customer_reviews.author: GaryKintheOC

product_meta.title: DEWALT Corded Drill, 8.0-Amp, 3/8-Inch, Variable Speed Reversible, Mid-Handle Grip (DWD115K )
product_meta.description:
Style:Corded GrillAMAZON.COM
Versatile and easy to handle, the DEWALT DWD115K 3/8-inch VSR mid-handle drill kit with keyless chuck delivers the power you need in a light-duty drill for all your drilling and fastening projects. Enjoy the drill's variable-speed trigger, convenient reversing switch, and comfortable mid-handle grip so you can work smarter for longer. 

 

3/8-Inch VSR Mid-Handle Drill Kit with Keyless Chuck
At a Glance:  * Reliable 8-amp motor
   
   
 * Variable-speed control from 0 to 2,500 RPM
   
   
 * Soft, non-slip rubber grip and lightweight design
   
   
 * Three-year limited warranty, one-year free service, 90-day money-back guarantee


The VSR mid-handle drill is ideal for a wide range of drilling and fastening applications. View larger. 
Mid-handle grip Patented DEWALT-Built Motor with Overload Protection
With its powerful 8-amp motor, the DEWALT DWD115K 3/8-inch VSR mid-handle drill is capable of delivering speeds of 0 to 2,500 RPM. This translates to quick, versatile drilling and driving.

Designed for Versatility and Durability
The dependable DWD115K is versatile enough for common around-the-home tasks and light, job-site work. The reversible drill features a 1-inch capacity when working in wood with a spade bit, and it can handle a capacity of 1-1/8 inches when used in wood with a hole saw. When used in steel with a twist bit, the drill can handle a capacity of 3/8-inch.

Its 3/8-inch ratcheting keyless chuck tightens as you work to deliver greater bit retention, and the drill's ball-bearing construction provides added durability.

Built with Comfortable, Accurate Handling in Mind
Comfortable handling goes a long way toward ensuring accurate results. The DWD115K is built to allow ergonomic hand positioning, and its soft grip and well-balanced design offer improved user comfort and better overall command of the drill. It also weighs an easy-to-manage 4.1 pounds, decreasing user fatigue after extended use.

The 3/8-inch VSR mid-handle drill kit with keyless chuck comes with a DEWALT warranty package that includes a three-year limited warranty, a one-year free service contract, and a 90-day money-back guarantee.

What's in the Box
One DEWALT DWD115K 3/8-inch VSR mid-handle drill and kit box.





The DEWALT VSR mid-handle drill comes with a durable kit box for safe keeping.
feature_bullets: 8-amp motor delivers high performance in heavy-duty applications
3/8-inch all-metal ratcheting keyless chuck for greater bit retention
0-2,500 RPM VSR trigger for versatility in drilling and fastening applications
Mid-handle grip design with soft grip provides increased balance and comfort
All ball-bearing construction provides greater durability and longer tool life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars519 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
